dublin_core.dcvalue: As some states allow motorists to use hands free cell phones only while driving this study was done to examine some braking responses to see if conversing on these two types of cell phones affects quick responding College age drivers n 25 completed reaction time trials in go no go situations under three conditions control no cell phone or conversation and conversing on hands free and hand held cell phones Their task involved moving the right foot from one pedal to another as quickly as possible in response to a visual signal in a lab setting Significantly slower reaction times movement times and total response times were found for both cell phone conditions than for the control but no differences between hands free and hand held phone conditions These findings provide additional support that talking on cell phones regardless if it is hands free or hand held reduces speed of information processing
Hands-free versus hand-held cell phone conversation on a braking response by young drivers.
